title: Discover
text:
Ideally this will use Real Peer Review to allow you to query and discover top rated papers on your preferred topics.
Curating and evaluating is the real botelneck in scientific publication.

title: FAQ
text: No. This is an experiment to show one can create a fully operational journal-like platform in a few hours. But there is no reason you can’t use it as a journal if you want.

title: FAQ
section: Did you create a Journal only to host your papers?
text:
Did you create a Journal only to host your papers?
Maybe, but this won’t be the first time (story about how Leigh Van Valen created his own Journal here).

title: FAQ
section: Nobody will use this / There is no way this is going to work.
text:
Nobody will use this / There is no way this is going to work.
This is not a question, but fine. Most likely I am not going to put the effort on making this page work beyond linking a few of my papers, but building this Anti-Journal allowed me to think freely and explore new ideas without constrains. The learned lessons will for sure be recycled elsewhere. And who knows, maybe you are wrong and people start using it.

title: FAQ
section: Do you have an Impact Factor?
text:
Do you have an Impact Factor?
Impact what?

title: Submit your paper
text: You already upload it online, you already have a DOI via Zenodo, why submit here? Just to show up!

title: Submit your paper
text:
Acceptance rates
We won’t accept just anything. We want to highlight papers that are open and reproducible, and that think in un-conventional ways to publish. Dynamic papers with updated versions, is something we are interested in.

title: Submit your paper
text:
How?
As easy to fill in this issue with the minimal information.

title: Submit your paper
section: Is there are peer review process?
text:
Is there are peer review process?
Of course not. Peer review is out of control. We [aim to] use plaud.it to allow the community to judge how trustable is the paper and highlight the most interesting ones, BUT you are the only one who can assess if a paper is valid.
